title: 2 wounded by afternoon gunfire in Birmingham park, including 11-year-old boy
content:
Two people - including an 11-year-old boy - were injured when gunfire erupted this afternoon near a Birmingham park.
Birmingham police spokesman Sgt. Bryan Shelton said some people were playing basketball at Grayson Park about 3 p.m. when the occupants of two nearby vehicles opened fire on each other. Neighbors reported hearing at least two shots fired.
The shooting happened on Five Mile Road across the street from Smith Middle School. Police and paramedics responded to the scene and found an 11-year-old boy had been grazed by one of the bullets.
A second victim, and adult male, showed up wounded at St. Vincent's Hospital and said he also had been injured at the park. He was shot in the shoulder and expected to be OK.
Shelton said the investigation is ongoing. So far, no one is in custody.
